intro: Fimbristylis polytrichoides, commonly known as the hairy sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often forming dense tussocks. Its leaves are linear and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its common name. The inflorescence consists of spikelets arranged in a cylindrical cluster, typical of the sedge family.
